intro: Luzula multiflora f. conglobata, commonly known as the clustered woodrush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale green flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its compact form and ornamental foliage make it a desirable plant for garden use in shaded landscapes.
